MultiAgentUnityWrapperEnv1 module¶

class MultiAgentUnityWrapperEnv1.MultiAgentUnityWrapperEnv1(config)¶

Bases: shiva.envs.Environment.Environment

Unity Wrapper that supports MLAgents version 1

Parameters

config (dict) – Expects a dictionary with the environment configurations.

Note

Loads in the Unity binary, extracts information about the agents, establishes the connection, and sets up initial values in order to begin stepping in the environment.

Returns

None

start_unity_environment() → None¶

Loads in the binary and passes an configs and props to the Unity end.

Returns

None

set_initial_values() → None¶

Gets the environment ready to begin the simulation.

Grabs the environment parameters, behaviors, and prepares dictionaries to store the DecisionSteps, TerminalSteps, and resets the metrics before beginning.

Returns

None

reset(force=False, *args, **kwargs) → None¶

Reset the environment and re-initialize metrics. :param force: Hard reset. :type force: bool

Returns

None

metric_reset(force=False, *args, **kwargs) → None¶

Re-initializes our metrics. Unity resets the environment on its own; called by Shiva Learner. :param force: Hard reset. :type force: bool

Returns

None

reset_agent_id(role, agent_id) → None¶

Empties the data accumulators for a specifc BehaviorName

Necessary whenever an agent’s trajectory ends with either success or failure.

Returns

None

step(actions) → Tuple[List, List, List, Dict]¶

Steps in the Unity Environment

Takes the actions given by the agent, processes them, and steps in the Unity Environment.

Returns

A tuple of lists of Observations, Rewards, Done Flags, and an Empty Dict for Legacy reasons.

collect_step_data() → None¶

Gets batches of data for the agents in the simulation.

Note

Although this function doesn’t return anything, the SARSA values are stored in internal data accumulator structures.

Returns

None

get_metrics(episodic=True) → List[None.dict.values]¶

MultiAgent Metrics

Used for Tensorboard.

Parameters

episodic (bool) – Indicates whether to get episodic or stepwise metrics.

Returns

A list of metric values

get_role_metrics(role: str, role_agent_id: int, episodic: bool = True) → List[Tuple[str, Any]]¶

Gets the metrics for a specific role

Used for Tensorboard.

Parameters

  • role (str) – BehaviorName of the agent.

  • role_agent_id (int) – Unique Agent Identifier.

  • episodic (bool) – Indicates whether to get episodic or stepwise metrics.

Returns

A list of metric tuples.

is_done(n_episodes: int = 0)¶

Check if there’s any role-agent that has finished the episode :param n_episodes: :type n_episodes: int

get_action_space_from_unity_spec(unity_spec: Dict) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Checks BehaviorSpec (Agent) has a discrete or continuous actionspace.

Used to infer the actionspace at runtime.

Parameters

unity_spec (Dict) – BehaviorName received from the unity environment.

Returns

Discrete

A dictionary of string, int pairs.

Continuous

A dictionary of string, tuple pairs.

get_observation_space_from_unity_spec(unity_spec: object)¶

This sums up the obeservation_shapes for the agents in a given BehaviorSpec

Returns

Integer

get_observations() → List[numpy.array]¶

Returns observations from the current step of each agent.

Returns

list of np.arrays

get_actions() → List[numpy.array]¶

Returns actions from the current step of each agent.

Returns

list of np.arrays

get_reward_episode() → Dict[str, float]¶

Returns the episodic rewards organized in a dictionary by role names.

Returns

Dictionary with roles and floats as key value pairs

get_rewards()¶

Returns stepwise reward for all the agents.

create_buffers(config=None)¶

Makes buffers for episodic trajectories to be stored in.

Returns

None

reset_buffers() → None¶

Empties the trajectory buffers for the next episode.

Returns

None

close()¶

Closes the connection with the Unity Environment. Also deletes the environment attribute from the Class. :returns: None

debug() → None¶

Prints out Behavior Names, and Batched Steps

Returns

None
